episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the most painful places to be stung by a bee, Walt Disney's unusual breakfast habits, the historical use of arsenic as 'inheritance powder' in France, and a study showing that shouting at drivers can improve their driving in Kenya.

facts.fact: The most painful place to be stung by a bee is your nostril.
Walt Disney used to eat breakfast like all of us, but his favorite breakfast was fresh doughnuts dunked in scotch.
The French used to call arsenic "poudre de succession" or "inheritance powder" because it was used in so many murders.
Shouting at drivers improves their driving.
